1.content:
Chase got up early the next morning and took a long shower and put some of dad's aftershave lotion on his cheeks. He ate a good breakfast that his mom made him and uses his dad's car to drive himself to his first day of work...hopefully, he thought. He arrives early and gets inside the mall and to the shoe store by ten minutes to 9 o'clock. Jim is working inside and looks up to see Chase. He opens the glass divider a bit and lets him in.

"Good Morning Chase, the store officially opens at ten, so we don't have much time for the interview..ok?" Chase shakes Jim's hand and follows him into a back office.

"Take a seat Chase, how do the shoes feel on your feet?"

"Well, their a bit snug around my toes and heel. I'll have to break them in". Chase exclaims.

"Well, its a bit informal, but you can take them off while we talk if you wish. I know you didn't have a chance to break them in since you bought them last night". Jim replies to Chase. Chase immediately kicks off each dress shoe and rubs his stocking feet and toes while he sighs. Jim looks over the filled out application and his letters of recommendations from his teachers and references.

"Wow, you come very well prepared and have great references. Have you ever sold shoes before?"

Chase shakes his head. "No, but I'm a quick learner and know about computers".

Jim pipes in "You sure do...tell you what, I'll hire you for the summer and then go from there. The pay is minimum wage plus commission. Weekends are our busiest days, so you'll get two weekdays off each week. Are you set to start today?"

Chase nods his head "Yes sure, thank you Jim! I won't let you down. I'll need some training though".

"Well, put on your shoes...actually skip that, you can train without your shoes for now. We got about forty-five minutes before the store opens, so let me show you around. The back warehouse is a bit dusty and in disarray due to some new racks being installed. You might want to wear something on your feet, so they won't get dirty or cut". Jim states as he looks down at Chase's stocking feet.

Jim sees a pair of designer flops a top a set of file cabinets and tells Chase to slip them on for the time being. Chase peels off his socks and slips his bare feet into the flops that fit perfectly.

"These would be great to wear instead of those dress shoes". Chase exclaims as he splays his bare toes.

Jim replies "Well, we do have some dress up days this summer when you'll be allowed to wear other footwear including flops and even going completely barefoot, but not until next month".

Chase follows Jim out to the sales floor and shows him around to the different types of shoes being sold, then to the back warehouse and shows him the layout and system for finding shoes. Lastly, he shows Chase the cash register.

"You will shadow me for the first day or so until you become comfortable with everything". Just then another young sales person comes in.
"Chase, this is Vince, Vince this is Chase, he'll be starting today" Jim says to Vince. Vince and Chase shake hands, but Vince notices Chase wearing flops and being barefoot.
"Don't worry, Chase has dress shoes in my office and plans to wear them when the store opens". Vince admires Chase's bare feet and toes, then walks to the back warehouse to clock in and store his belongings.

"Any questions Chase?" Jim says. Chase shakes his head. "Better go and put your dress socks and shoes back on your feet, we open in ten minutes". Chase walks into Jim's office and slips off the flops and begins to put on his socks and dress shoes. He winces as he walks back out to the sales floor just as the front door are pulled back.

A few customers come in and begin to look around. Chase shadows Jim for a while, then is pulled away by a mom looking for a pair of dock- siders for her teenage son. Chase can tell he wants something else, but wants to please the customer. The mom pulls her kid to a nearby chair and forces him to sit. He has blonde hair with fair skin and wearing a t-shirt, shorts and a beat up pair of sneakers with white socks.

"What size feet does your son have mam?" Chase asks the mom.

"I don't know, he grows so fast. Can you measure them?" the mom replies. Chase, now knowing how the gadget works, takes it from underneath his seat and sets it up. He begins to take hold of the youth's right foot and pull off the shoe, then peels off his sock and places his barefoot on the glass screen. His barefoot is lightly tan, hairless, but his toes are non-pedicured. They are okay, but oddly shaped with nails that need trimming. Chase jots down the measurements, then takes the youth's left shoe and sock off and measures it.

"Looks like an eight or eight and a half. I'll bring both sizes and some nylon stockings for his feet. These shoes are best worn without socks". Chase exclaims. He excuses himself and enters the back room to find the shoes. He emerges a moment later with two boxes and some nylon footies. Chase places the nylon footies on the youth's two bare feet and then puts on each dock-sider shoe.The youth gets up and walks around.

"How do they feel sir?". The youth shrugs his shoulders. Chase presses the top of each shoe and find out where the youth's toes are located. The youth says that they feel okay. "Let's try on the other size" Chase pipes in as he slips off the shoes from the youth's nylon covered feet. The nylon footies come off too exposing his bare feet again. He replaces them and puts on the second pair.
"Any better?". The youth walks around and cuts a smile.

"We'll take them sir". the Mom exclaims. "Wrap them up. They are for our cruise next week". Chase pulls the shoes and nylon footies off the youth's feet and places them in the box. Chase smiles at him before walking to the register. The youth's mom follows Chase as the youth sits there...

info.brief_description: Chase gets a new job selling shoes at the new shoe store inside the mall.
info.description:
Chase seemed to always be in the right place at the right time. He was a brown-haired, tan, well-built 16 year old youth who wanted to earn money to have fun. The first day of summer after completing his sophomore year in high school, Chase started looking for jobs everywhere. His mom bought him a nice shirt and tie for any interviews he might get. His dad brought him to the new shoe store in the mall to get a pair of dress shoes to help him look just right for them. It was there that he saw a sign announcing that they were hiring. The store wasn't busy with customers.
After looking around the store for a while, the manager himself waits on Chase and his dad. He has Chase sit down in a chair to measure his feet. Chase was casually dressed in a t-shirt, shorts with sneakers and black socks. The manager pulls off Chase's shoes and places his black stocking feet on a futuristic type foot-measuring object. He types in Chase's age and height and then places Chase's right stocking foot on the glass screen. After some adjustments, he moves Chase's foot to different parts of the screen.

"This new equipment seems to always breakdown at the wrong time...it worked perfect this morning" the manager exclaims to Chase.

"No worries, it's probably the a connection problem...mind if take a look?" Chase replies. The manager hands him the object. After some computer strokes and checking the connections, Chase cleans the screen, then hands it back to the manager.

"Hey, you're pretty handy with computers...do you want a job here at the shoe store? I could sure use another sales person and in your case... techie".

Surprised, Chase looks over at his dad, then to the manager "I sure do...I was getting these shoes for possible interviews, but now I don't need them".

"Well, you would have to wear dress shoes while on duty here, so I'll tell you what. You work for me and I'll give you the shoes for half off!" the manager exclaims. He places the measuring object on the floor and takes Chase's right foot and places it on the glass screen.

"Oh...and this might be part of the problem". He peels Chase's sock off his foot exposing his tan, hairless barefoot with pedicured, slender toes. "This new measuring object only works with feet that are bare". He looks down and admires Chase's bare foot and toes. Chase wiggles his toes. "Those are sure some nice looking feet for a young man your age. Most of the feet I have to measure are dirty, have dry skin or not pedicured. Your bare feet look breath taking". The manager takes down the measurements, then peels off Chase's other sock and places his left foot on the glass screen. "and they don't smell that bad". He excuses himself while he retrieves the shoes from the back.
Chase stands up and walks around barefoot. The carpet tickles his bare soles.

"I can see myself working here and making some good money...everyone needs shoes right?" His dad nods his head as the manager returns with a few boxes and a pair of dress socks. He instructs Chase to put the dress socks on his bare feet while he unpacks the first box. He slips on the right shoe onto Chase's right foot and ties it. He does the same with the left shoe on Chase's left foot. Chase gets up and walks around.

"How do they feel?" the manager asks Chase. Chase walks around some more and returns.

"Their a little tight, maybe a half inch or more should do it" Chase responds. The manager unties the shoes and takes them off Chase's feet and gets the second pair ready. After getting them on Chase's feet, Chase walks around and tells him that they fit perfect and smiles.
"I'll take them" Chase exclaims. The manager again unties and removes the dress shoes, then peels off the dress socks from Chase's bare feet leaving them bare again. Chase wiggles his toes. The manager wraps up the shoes in the box again and brings them and the pair of dress socks to the counter to ring them up. Chase's dad gets up and follows him. Chase gathers up his socks and shoes and walks barefoot to the counter.

"Those dress shoes really killed my feet and toes, I'll need to break them in fast" Chase tells the manager. The manager again admires Chase's bare feet from behind the counter. He begins to put his socks back on as the transaction is almost complete. Chase is handed an application and a business card.

"Come by tomorrow at 9 am for a formal interview, if everything checks out...you can start tomorrow!" the manager tells Chase. "By the way, I'm Jim, Jim Dancer". Chase smiles as he ties his sports shoes.

"Thanks...see you tomorrow morning" Chase says as he leaves. The manager waves and closes the cash register.
